intro: Hiraea grandifolia var. grandifolia, commonly known as the large-leaved hiraea, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its large, broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in composite heads, which are composed of many small florets. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
